intro: Paryphantha mitchelliana, commonly known as Mitchell's paryphantha, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow petals and a central disk, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Paryphantha mitchelliana is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
